name: Prakash Venkat
title: Programmer
description: I build things with computers. I'm always looking for a challenging problem that lets me push new limits on what computation is and can be used for.

experiences.title: Staff Software Engineer
experiences.description: Helping clients across industries adopt and implement AI solutions, from LLM-powered products to ML pipelines.

experiences.title: Senior Tech Lead
experiences.description: Developed software for auditors while leading a team of five engineers.
bullets: Led discovery sessions with auditors and compliance teams to gather feedback on Third Party Risk Management prototypes, iterating with product and design to deliver vendor assessment workflows that met SOX and internal audit requirements.

Designed database schema changes to model third-party vendor risk assessments, control testing, and compliance workflows; codified data model changes in Engineering Design Documents for cross-team review. Built with Ember, C#, and Python.
Broke down TPRM features into user stories, allocated epics to a team of seven engineers, and used LaunchDarkly to orchestrate percentage-based rollouts to enterprise audit teams.

experiences.title: Senior Principal Engineer
experiences.description: Built products for clients ranging from garage start up to large enterprise. Shipped software written in many different languages and tech stacks. Mentored junior engineers and helped them reach their career goals. Led all of our technical screens for new candidates and refined our interview process.
bullets: Partnered with clients from blockchain startups to NBC/Rotten Tomatoes to define MVP scope, conducted stakeholder meetings to determine requirements, and delivered production-ready products across diverse domains including media, fintech, health tech, and hospitality.

bullets.text: Solved unique technical challenges across client engagements:
subBullets: Built a Decentralized Social Network Protocol in Rust/Substrate for Project Liberty
Optimized Rotten Tomatoes data ingestion from 2 hours to 2 minutes using Java concurrency
Extended an in-house DSL with Boolean operators for Shaklee's DNA-to-supplement matching
Delivered GDPR/CCPA-compliant audit logging for Sensei's wellness platform

bullets: Led cross-functional teams of up to 15 engineers and designers, conducted daily standups and weekly sprint planning, and mentored junior engineers while refining Carbon Five's technical interview process.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Number 4 engineering hire at a financial technology startup whose mandate was a sustainable online banking product.
bullets: As an early engineering hire (#4), shaped the product roadmap for a sustainable online banking platform, collaborating closely with leadership to build core banking features from the ground up.

subBullets: Designed a batch processing system to ingest ACH files from partner banks with a flexible formatter that adapted to schema changes
Created a check payments application enabling users to issue and deposit checks on recurring intervals
Transitioned authentication from JWTs to session cookies using Spring Auth

bullets: Instilled engineering best practices by revamping the code review process with PR size limits and approval requirements, establishing retrospectives, and creating developer onboarding scripts to prepare new hire workstations.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Created a photoshop-like GUI for creating interactive ads.
bullets: Worked with Sales teams to understand the needs of interactive artists, developing a training program to onboard new users to the ad creation platform.

bullets.text: Built a Photoshop-like WYSIWYG editor for creating interactive advertisements:
subBullets: Designed the editor in Angular 2, later leading the migration to React
Used RxJS to create a responsive, event-driven UI for real-time ad preview and manipulation

bullets: Collaborated across engineering and sales to iterate on editor features based on artist feedback, ensuring the tool met the creative workflows of ad designers.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Built an HTML5 framework for creating gameified advertisements.
bullets: Coordinated with major publishers including the New York Times, Cond√© Nast, Town & Country, and Stella Artois to understand campaign requirements and launch sophisticated interactive ad experiences.

bullets.text: Built an HTML5 competitor to Flash for gamified advertisements:
subBullets: Created an interactive web framework in vanilla JavaScript for cross-browser ad experiences
Implemented one of the first MRAID (Mobile Rich Media Ad Interface) specifications for displaying web ads in native mobile apps
Delivered infrastructure for serving ads inside iOS and Android WebView components

bullets: Worked directly with brand and publisher teams to iterate on ad experiences, ensuring campaigns met both creative vision and technical constraints across web and mobile platforms.

experiences.title: Junior Software Engineer
experiences.description: Online tools for teaching high school math.
bullets: Collaborated with educators to understand the needs of teachers and school administrators, delivering tools that helped identify struggling students and classrooms not meeting performance thresholds.

bullets.text: Built both sides of an interactive math learning platform:
subBullets: Designed a lesson authoring tool for teachers with an embedded LaTeX renderer for clean math equations
Built a student-facing UI for consuming interactive lessons
Created analytics dashboards for administrators to track student and classroom performance

bullets: As a junior engineer, worked closely with senior developers and educators to iterate on features, gaining foundational experience in full-stack development and user-centered design.
